name: elder-crates
description: Helps Rust developers spot outdated dependencies in `Cargo.toml` manifest files. Supports crates.io, alternate registries, and crates.io mirrors that offers the sparse protocol.

elder-crates.useCargoCache.description: If true, Cargo's index cache is searched first before the registries. Cache must be stored in the sparse format.

elder-crates.cratesIoIndex.description: The index URL of the default crates.io registry. Change this value only if you use a mirror of crates.io. The index must use the sparse protocol. Use a file URL if the mirror is on disk.

elder-crates.cratesIoCache.markdownDescription: The index cache directory of the default crates.io registry. Change this value only if you use a remote or local mirror of crates.io. You can find the directories at CARGO_HOME/registry/index.

name.description: The name of the registry. It must be the same as your dependencies' "registry" key.

index.description: The index URL of the registry. The index must use the sparse protocol. Use a file URL if the registry is on disk.

cache.description: Cargo's index cache directory of the registry. You can find the directories at CARGO_HOME/registry/index. Cache is not searched for the registry if this property is not given.

docs.description: The docs URL of the registry, if one exists. The link to the docs of a specific version of a crate is obtained by `${docs}${name}/${version}`. This is only used when rendering hover messages on the decorators.

elder-crates.registries.description: A list of alternate registries. The index of an alternate registry must support the sparse protocol.

elder-crates.gitArchive.markdownDescription: Enable `git archive` method for fetching versions from git dependencies. Requires `git`, `sh`, and `tar` to be available on PATH. Only works with git servers that support `git archive --remote`.

elder-crates.experimentalShallowClone.markdownDescription: **Experimental**: Enable shallow clone method for fetching versions from git dependencies. Creates temporary directories and runs git commands. Requires `git` to be available on PATH.

scripts.vscode:prepublish: tsc && biome ci src && vite build --minify
